results.title: Call of the home village = Xiang qing
results.creator_credit: Li Bangjin, Jin Wang, Bingliu Hu and Pearl River Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Qiuyue’s adopted son, Tiangui is going to marry her daughter, Cuicui. But Tiangui’s biological parents have now learnt where their estranged son is and are against the marriage. Qiuyue sends Tiangui back to his parents, who joined the revolution in the early years and are now senior officials living in the city. Tiangui’s mother is excited to see her son and arrange everything for him to begin a new life. Tiangui is not comfortable with the easy life and misses his foster mum and fiancée in the country. Tiangui’s mother tries all means to prevent her son going back, and she wants Tiangui to marry the daughter of a colleague. Noticing the problem, Tiangui’s father blames his wife and asks Tiangui to invite Qiuyue and Cuicui to their home. However, Tiangui’s mother sends a letter to Qiuyue, telling her that only Cuicui is invited. Tiangui would not go without Qiuyue, and Qiuyue eventually compromises. At Tiangui’s home, Qiuyue accidentally finds out that Tiangui’s parents are the couple that she saved years ago. She did not tell the truth to her children but chose to leave without letting anybody know.

Similar to The Green Mountain of Bamboo (1982), this film also deals with young people’s free love. Traditionally in China, a couple’s marriage would be arranged by their parents. Very often, the couple would have no chance to meet with each other before their wedding day. Arranged marriage is regarded as a “feudal concept” and thus criticized by the CCP. Produced in the early 1980s, this film delivers a message to the audience that CCP members must not be corrupted by feudal ideas. (2 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: By the light of the moon
results.creator_credit: Media, Applied Communications, RMIT, Alex Vagic, Christine Rogers and Broadmeadows Secondary College
results.brief_description: “By the light of the moon” tells the story of two refugee girls, their reasons for leaving their home countries, their experiences, and how they came to be living in Broadmeadows and attending the Broadmeadows Secondary College. Essentially the film is about hope and optimism. Despite the difficulties faced by the two girls, and an acknowledgement that they can never forget the past, through sharing their stories they gain acceptance. They begin to connect with the community in which they now live, and have hope for the future.

results.title: Camelot
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from the very successful Broadway show, “Camelot” features songs from the renowned songwriting team of Lerner and Loewe. Starring Richard Harris, Vanessa Redgrave, Franco Nero, David Hemmings and Lionel Jeffries, it tells of the tragic romantic triangle between Arthur, Guinevere and Sir Lancelot.

results.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid [DVD]
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, John Foreman and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Butch Cassidy (Paul Newman) and the Sundance Kid (Robert Redford) are two of the West’s more audacious Frontier outlaws. Following their various schemes and robberies, “Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid” is both a Western comedy and a ‘buddy’ movie. Redford and Newman play the bandits of the title with charm and style, sparring with one another, whilst cooking up adventurous plans. Joining them in their tomfoolery is Sundance’s girlfriend Etta Place (Katherine Ross), a schoolteacher, with a soft spot for both men. “Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid” is a revisionist Western which toys with the convention of the bandit who outsmarts the law with stealth, in this case accidents of fate being a major factor in Butch and Sundance’s success. The film pitches Butch and Sundance, with their values firmly defined by the code of the Old West, against the ways of a new modern order. William Goldman won an Academy Award for best original screenplay. Original music by Burt Bacharach and costumes by Edith Head.

results.title: Came a hot friday
results.creator_credit: Ian Mune, Larry Parr, Challenge Film Corporation and Mirage Films
results.brief_description: It is 1949. The privations of war are over and there is money to be made! Two conmen have been successfully cheating bookies at racetracks across the United States. When they stop at a small town called Tainuia Junction, their luck runs out. After waging a war with the local police and the owner of the town casino, they enlist the aid of the Tainuia Kid, a Zorro nut and the wildest comic ever to ride the ranges. It is the bad guys versus the not-so-bad guys in this off-the-wall comedy that takes the viewer on a rollercoaster of laughs against a backdrop of horseracing, gambling, fast cars and loose women. Starring Billy T. James, Peter Bland, Phillip Gordon and Marshall Napier. Based on the novel by Ronald Hugh Morrieson.

results.title: Bush doctor
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Flying physician, Dr Paul-Leon Rivard, paper company doctor at Clova, Quebec, has a practice overing 6000 patients scattered over 50,000 square km of the Abitibi region. He manages to cover the wilderness by plane, dog team and snowshoe, to help wherever needed.

results.title: Cambodia: Fields of hope
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger and Australian Television Network
results.brief_description: As seen on ATN 7s “World Around Us”, this documentary looks at the lives of the Cambodian people one decade after the downfall of Pol Pot. Over one million Cambodians lost their lives as a result of his genocidal policies. A train trip across Cambodia, reveals a country and people freed from the shackles of tyrannical despotism. It is a film of enormous courage which offers a unique insight into the culture and strength of a country torn apart by political and social genocide.

results.title: Calypso Summer
results.creator_credit: Lincoln Tyner and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1960-61 a team of cricketers from the West Indies visited Australia. The came as underdogs, and although Australia won the series of Tests, they left the country as one of the most loved sporting teams ever to visit Australia. This video is an informative mixture of archival footage, humourous anecdotes and poignant reflections by surviving players from the Test series, one that has become the benchmark against which all great Test series are judged and compared. Narrated by Michael Habib.

results.title: Buried alive, the story of East Timor
results.creator_credit: Rod Hibberd, Fabio Cavadini and Gil Scrine
results.brief_description: In this film we see why the East Timor question is too important to go away. “The Story of East Timor” begins in a neglected corner of the Portuguese colonial empire. In Lisbon, the unexpected fall of the dictatorship projects the people of East Timor into world politics. It is to be a terrible experience. “Buried Alive” exposes some of the ugly truths about the nature of Western democracy, the world media and Third World Colonialism. Rated: PG
